definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items

sentences.chinese: 是的，我有一點點的神經質。

sentences.english: They knock each other off balance just a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 她說，“他們只是一點點敲擊彼此的不平衡之處。”

sentences.english: A little bit of commercialism can help kids make connections with their peers.
sentences.chinese: 一點點的商業主義能幫助孩子們與同類人間建立聯繫。

sentences.english: And he was still lying about his age, just a little bit.
sentences.chinese: 他現在也虛報了年齡，說小了那麼一點點。

sentences.english: A bailment of telesthesia you are in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 你是我心上一點點寄託。

sentences.english: The fiber and protein boost allows a small serving with great contentment.
sentences.chinese: 攝入一點點纖維素和蛋白質，就會得到大大的滿足。

sentences.english: At a minimum, she hopes for at least a modicum of attraction.
sentences.chinese: 至少，她希望能遇到一個對她有一點點吸引力的人。

sentences.english: Hardly a whisper of concern has been voiced.
sentences.chinese: 幾乎一點點關心也未曾表示過。

sentences.english: Just a little bit in a dressing spoils the whole salad?
sentences.chinese: 僅僅調料汁裏的一點點就弄糟了一整盤色拉？

sentences.english: Seen from a distance, the room has only a faint light.
sentences.chinese: 從遠處看，房間裏只透出一點點熒火。

sentences.english: "I had no plan, not even mileage goals," she says.
sentences.chinese: “我沒有計劃，沒有一點點目標了，”她說道。

sentences.english: But we do need a little freedom from our leashes on occasion.
sentences.chinese: 當然有時候也需要不受羈絆和一點點的自由。

sentences.english: Too often we judge people on too little information.
sentences.chinese: 我們時常通過一點點信息來評斷一個人。

sentences.english: MBTs weigh slightly more than two pounds each.
sentences.chinese: 一隻MBT鞋的重量是兩磅多一點點。

sentences.english: She damned his character for a few faults.
sentences.chinese: 她抓住一點點毛病就說他的品質很壞。

sentences.english: Barney knew scantiest amount of French and not a syllable of anything else.
sentences.chinese: 巴尼只懂一點點法文，其他外語一個字都不會。

definition: Diandian (Chinese microblogging and social networking website)
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
